extendedIngredients.name: celery
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup finely diced celery (lightly sauteed so that they remain crunchy)
metaInformation: (lightly sauteed so that they remain crunchy)

extendedIngredients.name: pork sausage
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 -3/4 lb pork andouille sausage (finely chopped, browned, and cooked. I sliced my sausages into 1/2 inch thick slices and then divided each slice into quarters)
metaInformation: (, browned, and cooked. I my sausages into 1/ slices and then each slice into quarters)

recipes.title: Cornbread Stuffing Muffins

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel are my top picks for Southern. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. The Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling
productMatches.description: The Cold Creek Riesling is made from 40-year-old vines which contribute fruit intensity and concentration. This is a ripe, lush style of Riesling with aromas of ripe peaches, dried apricots and spice notes. It displays beautiful ripe fruit flavors with a crisp finish.

recipes.instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375F. Line muffin tin with cupcake liners. In a large bowl, add all the cornbread ingredients and mixwith a whisk until everything is blended. Scoop batter into cupcake liners, filling between 1/2 to 2/3 full. You should be able to make 12 muffins.2. In a separate bowl, add all the filling ingredients and mix together. Scoop a heaping 1 tbsp of stuffing into the middle of each muffin. Try to make sure each one has an even amount of all the stuffing ingredients. I like having about 4-5 pieces of sausage in each one.3. Bake for about 20 minutes until muffins are done. Serve warm. Garnish with additional scallions if desired.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375F. Line muffin tin with cupcake liners. In a large bowl, add all the cornbread ingredients and mixwith a whisk until everything is blended. Scoop batter into cupcake liners, filling between 1/2 to 2/3 full. You should be able to make 12 muffins.2. In a separate bowl, add all the filling ingredients and mix together. Scoop a heaping 1 tbsp of stuffing into the middle of each muffin. Try to make sure each one has an even amount of all the stuffing ingredients. I like having about 4-5 pieces of sausage in each one.3.
Bake for about 20 minutes until muffins are done.
Garnish with additional scallions if desired.
